alert.note: Alert for Anson; Cumberland; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 30 at 4:52PM EDT until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Coastal Plain, Sandhills, and portions of the Piedmont of North Carolina, including the following counties: Anson, Cumberland, Edgecombe, Franklin, Halifax, Harnett, Hoke, Johnston, Lee, Montgomery, Moore, Nash, Richmond, Sampson, Scotland, Stanly, Wake, Wayne and Wilson. * WHEN...Through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Flooding from Tropical Storm Idalia is possible across southern and eastern portions of central North Carolina tonight through Thursday evening. Rainfall amounts will be highest, between 4 and 8 inches, along and south of a line from Laurinburg to Fayetteville to Goldsboro, with 1 to 4 inches elsewhere. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
